title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=f975f1c3093a3d9598a1da39854b03d1250bd55d
comments: Playing Forza Horizon 5 on and off, gotten back to the AC franchise after a long time, started playing Unity. Arcane has made me want to get back into playing LoL so might just do that.
Playing destiny 2.
I like playing Persona 3 because I'm a huge weeb
Playing Genshin Impact as usual, the next version 2.3 seems really good.

Civilization VI is destroying my life.

If i've dodged calls, delayed work, forgotten to eat, shower or get up, it's because Greece needs to be taught a lesson, right after I finish teaching Jerusalem and England their lessons. And also I need to connect Mumbai and London by road. Just one more turn then.
Playing Borderlands 2. I havenâ€™t had this much fun in a long ass time. I find rpgs to be slow but this one does it well. Killing enemies is always fun
Hollow knight

Was playing Red dead redemption 2. Really lovely game. Now playing assassin's creed valhalla. Initial gameplay seems nice. I didnt liked the recent titles in the AC series like origin and odyssy. Heard about valhalla a lot, so gave it a try

I have finally started enjoying AC Unity, after going through movement guides on youtube. Parkour is still clunky, cover feature is quite bad but roaming through revolutionary France is becoming fun now.
Valhalla, from what I heard, is worse than Origins and Odyssey.
Is it? Oh well.
Playing pillars of eternity 2 and it takes two.
Did you finish RDR2 story completely? How long it took?
Wow
yes
Age of History 2. Nice indie game.
Tbh I am playing Odyssey and it looks and feels like Origins ðŸ˜­ðŸ˜­
Yep I did. It took a while. But I'd say it worth every minute of gameplay

Origin Odyssy and Valhalla, these are interconnected. From what I heard. Similar gameplay, parkour and combat. 
So I chose valhalla to play, just to explore vikings and norse mythology more.

Got into EFT a couple of days ago (level 5 rn), having a lot of fun. Just learnt woods, will be learning reserve and/or interchange next. I know I joined pretty late-ish wipe but next wipe it'll be an even better experience.
Dota 2
What servers do Indians play on? I've come across any Indians on the west coast, lots of Chinese tho.
I am sorry man, i did the same about 4 months ago before quitting completely and i am in a much better place.
started "control" looks interesting
Dota2
rn I play on HK servers and haven't come across any hackers. I think my ISP has f*cked something up, as I am getting more ping on SG than on HK servers.

Getting into CyberPunk 2077 after the latest update.
Much less buggy and good cpu performance also.
The normal FPS stuff you know, CS and Valorant, Sometimes Vampire Masquerade
